Telltale sharp winds in lieu of warm breezes leaves falling to expose skeletal trees and couples huddled together to preserve warmth signal that winter is on its way PERIOD

Preparations have begun PERIOD Thanksgiving recipes are being reviewed and the Martha Stewart types have already moved on to Christmas decor PERIOD However less visible than the morning frosts and falling leaves are the homeless huddled together against the winters cold PERIOD

Its in these cold months that programs and shelters for the homeless become most important PERIOD

Students for Social Change SCC a group from the Community and Environmental Planning undergraduate program is working to enlighten the community about homelessness issues PERIOD This November is the second annual Housing and Homelessness Awareness Month PERIOD

Last Tuesday marked the first of three panel discussions utilizing local expertise to build recognition of housing and homeless problems PERIOD

Climbing stairs to the third floor of the HUB the chill of autumn was left behind for people who were gathered to hear a lesson in local history PERIOD

 said panel member Trevor Griffey a freelance writer and Ph.D PERIOD student in the UWs American history program PERIOD

Griffey explained that the negative view of homelessness is fairly recent PERIOD

These issues didnt arise from a sequence of abstract market forces or from the cumulative effect of consequences from the decisions of thousands of individuals he said PERIOD Rather the problems have arisen directly out of littleknown government policies urbanrenewal projects zoning codes federal laws subsidies tax breaks  these all contributed to the problems we now see PERIOD

 he further explained PERIOD

Fellow panel member David Bloom of the Interfaith Task Force on Homelessness added that the deinstitutionalization of mentalhealth facilities brought many mentally ill patients into the streets as well PERIOD

 said Bloom PERIOD 

He did however pin down one of the main factors adding to homelessness PERIOD

 said Bloom PERIOD

Panel member Siobhan Ring of the Tenants Rights Union said 

He said after listening to the explanations of how things came to be the way they are the most striking thing was the lack of attendees PERIOD There should be people crammed into this room PERIOD More people should be outside straining to hear each word spoken by these people PERIOD These people have watched this form of homelessness evolve or more accurately devolve to what it is now he said PERIOD
